title: Commercial Graduate Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Gettysburg College (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Short 30 min interview with talent person, did not know if they knew the area I was applying for as well but good into interview. Hopefully looking to get a second interview or whatever comes next.
Interview Questions: General, also about how I would handle certain client related scenarios

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Gettysburg College (Gettysburg, PA) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was about eight hours long. Meeting with several different departments personnel and students. While the process was long, it was thorough and enjoyable. At no time did I feel uncomfortable or unwanted.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply here?

title: Member Of Technical Staff Interview
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was virtual, got to meet the entire team and understand everyone’s roles. Definitely appreciate the good communication from the hiring manager and staff and how inviting everyone was.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel you are the best fit for this role?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: It was a relaxed interview that targeted general employment questions. I met with two women in the office and we discussed things like my strengths, weakness, and why I should be hired. Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

title: House Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Gettysburg College (Gettysburg, PA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was very pleasant I can say that the interviewer was very nice in the way they were talking and making me feel comfortable. I felt as if there was such a great experience applying for this position
Interview Questions: What is one time where you failed and how did you overcome it?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Gettysburg College
Interview Descriptions: The interview was six hours long. You are provided an opportunity to meet with other administrative members. This was a helpful opportunity. However, a six hour interview for pay that was not much more than offered at Target, was a disappointment. I declined in the interview based on the low pay. In addition, they do not allow employees education opportunity for five years.
Interview Questions: Am I able to work independently?

title: Dive Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Gettysburg College
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly easy. The interviewer was very nice and friendly. She made sure it was a comfortable environment. It mostly depended on how early you applied for the job.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked at a cafeteria before?

title: Assistant Director of Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Gettysburg College (Gettysburg, PA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: An encouraging, pleasant initial phone screening was followed by a more extensive phone interview with a panel of five interviewers. Many questions were vague. When I tried to engage the interviewers to obtain more specifics about a few questions, none were given. Their demeanor suggested that I was the final interview and they had their sights set on another candidate.  I received a rejection email a few hours later, somewhat confirming my suspicions.
Interview Questions: How would you go about writing and promoting an 800-word article?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Gettysburg College (Gettysburg, PA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: All day interview involving a campus tour, presentation and meeting with individuals and groups of people. Began with a phone interview then an invitation to come to campus for the all day one.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with/address conflict?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Gettysburg College
Interview Descriptions: Typical on-campus interview. No teaching demo required. Faculty seemed over-worked and exhausted. Typical on-campus interview. No teaching demo required. Faculty seemed over-worked and exhausted. Typical on-campus interview. No teaching demo required. Faculty seemed over-worked and exhausted.
Interview Questions: What classes would you like to teach?

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Gettysburg College (Gettysburg, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great. I had to give an hour job talk. They tried to test how good is the candidate in terms of knowledge and research. They were polite and nice even when they tried to test the candidate.
Interview Questions: Are you really interested in working in a small place like Gettysburg

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Gettysburg College (Gettysburg, PA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I sent a resume and cover letter with teaching philosophy, etc. Two people, the chair of the department and the professor whose course I would be covering, interviewed me over Skype. I received an answer by email a couple of days later. It was easy.
Interview Questions: How do I conduct my classes?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Gettysburg College (Gettysburg, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was treated disrespectfully and later found out that the interview process was a sham.  They already had a hire in mind before they engaged in the interview process.  Was asked inappropriate questions.
Interview Questions: Would you be uncomfortable being the only minority person in the department?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Gettysburg College
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process is really simple just fill out an application on line and wait for them to call.  once you have an interview set up make sure you dress nice, they will ask you a  few questions about your experience but nothing to bad
Interview Questions: Most questions are simple if you are experienced at all in the security field.

title: Leadership Interview
Interview Descriptions: Had two interviews; the first one was a group interview, and the last one was an individual interview!
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflicts? Being someone who used to avoid and stay away from conflicts, I was not ready to open up about this weakness, but I'm glad I did; I have grown quite a lot ever since

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Gettysburg College (Gettysburg, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Process took about 2 weeks from initial contact. Interview was very converational and pleasant. It was aimed more at getting to know the candidate rather than just a series of cookie cutter questions. Interviewed with everyone in teh department as a panel and then a one on one with each person afterward.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Fitness Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Gettysburg College (Gettysburg, PA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a current employee. The hiring manager reached out to me and had a brief conversation and i was hired. Thats about it hi hi hi hi hi hi

title: Athletic Center Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Gettysburg College (Gettysburg, PA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: When I noticed an opening in a job I was interested in I immediately contacted the employer.  He recognized my experience and eagerness, and provided me with an opportunity.
Interview Questions: Why do you believe you are qualified for this position?

title: Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Gettysburg College (Gettysburg, PA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: very long process depending on position applying for. most are three hours long if completed in one day.
Interview Questions: lots of questions covering knowledge of position, personality, customer service, etc.
